DataElement.preferredName: Fluorescence in Situ Hybridization Molecular Abnormality Present Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow a person to participate in a clinical study that are related to the present of cytogenetic or molecular by using physical mapping approach of fluorescent tags to detect hybridization of probes within metaphase chromosomes or less condensed somatic interphase chromatin as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Fluorescence in Situ Hybridization Molecular Abnormality Present Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A physical mapping approach that uses fluorescent tags to detect hybridization of probes within metaphase chromosomes or less condensed somatic interphase chromatin. This technique can be used for identification of chromosomal abnormalities and for gene mapping._A molecular or cytogenic abnormality which occurs in either human disease states or disease models._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Fluorescence in Situ Hybridization Molecular Abnormality
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A physical mapping approach that uses fluorescent tags to detect hybridization of probes within metaphase chromosomes or less condensed somatic interphase chromatin. This technique can be used for identification of chromosomal abnormalities and for gene mapping.:A molecular or cytogenic abnormality which occurs in either human disease states or disease models.

Concepts.definition: A physical mapping approach that uses fluorescent tags to detect hybridization of probes within metaphase chromosomes or less condensed somatic interphase chromatin. This technique can be used for identification of chromosomal abnormalities and for gene mapping.
A molecular or cytogenetic abnormality which occurs in either human disease states or disease models.

Property.preferredDefinition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is a cytogenetic rearrangemen
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is a cytogenetic rearrangement of KMT2A (MLL) by interphase Fluorescent in-situ Hybridization (FISH) present?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have high risk cytogenetics using fluorescent in situ hybridization (FISH) [del(17p), t(4;14), t(14;16), t(14;20), chromosome 1 abnormalities, MYC translocation, tetrasomies, complex karyotype, high-risk gene expression signature (if available), high LDH, or extramedullary MM?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have high risk cytogenetics using fluorescent in situ hybridization (FISH) [del(17p), t(4;14), t(14;16), t(14;20), chromosome 1 abnormalities, MYC translocation, tetrasomies, high LDH, or extramedullary MM?
